description: y such that y^2 = C(x,0) + C(x,1) + C(x,2) + C(x,3) is soluble.
references: R. K. Guy, Unsolved Problems in Number Theory, Section D3.
mathematica: r[x_] := Reduce[y >= 0 && 6*y^2 == (x + 1)*(x^2 - x + 6), {y}, Integers]; Reap[ Do[ If[r[x] =!= False, Sow[y /. ToRules[r[x]]]], {x, -10, 1000}]][[2, 1]] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Jul 12 2012 *)
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
